taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Feeds on worms, crustaceans and insects (Ref. 7020).  Aquarium keeping:  in pairs; minimum aquarium size 60 cm (Ref. 51539).  Eggs are deposited on the ceiling of caves and are tendered by the female parent (Ref. 1672).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: South America:  Paraguay River basin and along the lower Paraná River in Argentina
dataObjects.references: Kullander, S.O. 2003 Cichlidae (Cichlids). p. 605-654. In R.E. Reis, S.O. Kullander and C.J. Ferraris, Jr. (eds.) Checklist of the Freshwater Fishes of South and Central America. Porto Alegre: EDIPUCRS, Brasil. (Ref. 36377)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Paraguay River basin and along lower Paraná River in Argentina: Argentina, Brazil and Paraguay.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.references: Kullander, S.O. 2003 Cichlidae (Cichlids). p. 605-654. In R.E. Reis, S.O. Kullander and C.J. Ferraris, Jr. (eds.) Checklist of the Freshwater Fishes of South and Central America. Porto Alegre: EDIPUCRS, Brasil. (Ref. 36377)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Diseases
dataObjects.description: Costia Disease. Parasitic infestations (protozoa, worms, etc.)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#LifeCycle
dataObjects.description: Produces 50-70 eggs. The eggs are attached to the ceiling of caves, female cares for eggs and larvae. (Ref. 1672).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Uses
dataObjects.title: Importance
dataObjects.description: fisheries: of no interest; aquarium: commercial

dataObjects.title: File:Gelber Buntbarsch.JPG
dataObjects.description: Apistogramma sp., probably umbrella cichlid (Apistogramma borellii) or a hybrid thereof.

dataObjects.title: File:Apistogramma borelli opal.JPG
dataObjects.description: English: 1=A male opal-coloured umbrella cichlid (Apistogramma borelli "opal") and two southern platyfish (Xiphophorus maculatus)

dataObjects.title: File:Apistogramma borellii.jpg
dataObjects.description: German: 1=Ein Apistogramma borellii Pärchen in Naturform. Man sieht schön die unterschiedlichen Größen und Farben der Geschlechter. Rechts das größere Männchen.
